results.title: Robert Klippel
results.creator_credit: Keith Salvat, Keisal Films and Australia Council
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Painters, the sculptors: archival art series”.
Robert Klippel is viewed as one of Australia’s most important artists of the fifties and sixties. His humble beginnings (and obsession) with ship modelmaking was to influence and inform his work throughout his career as an artist. Klippel was a self-taught artist whose interest sprung from the processes he’d developed while model building, a scale which was to continue in his work throughout his career. Klippel had a strong preference for the solid built form of sculpture but found his work naturally becoming more linear in style. His developed language in the fifties and his need for intellectual peers saw him travel to Europe and New York to again resettle in Sydney, Australia where he developed strong artistic allies and his notoriety as an abstract expressionist artist along with Olsen and Passmore. This documentary charts Klippel’s role in a developing cultural nation.

results.title: [New Zealand Weekly Review. No. 201]
results.brief_description: Newreel items include: 1. UNRRA. Clothes for Europe, loading stores for refugees in Europe. 2. Hastings - Spring show. 3. Temuka - Bailey Bridge in Civvies. Wartime Bailey Bridge erected to help country area. 4. From war to peace - returned servicemen train for the building industry. 5. McKenzie Country - down from the tops.

results.title: Ram sales
results.brief_description: This is a general interest film which shows typical scenes at the annual Sydney sheep show, including judging. It also illustrates the different areas of country in relation to ram types, and shows various wool fabrics and types of wool from which fabrics are manufactured. Photography by Tom Price and commentary by Wilfred Thomas.

results.title: [Matthew Flinders: bi-centennial celebrations 1974]
results.creator_credit: Country Roads Board, Department of Agriculture and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Captures the various bi-centennial celebrations that were organised in Victoria to commemorate the birth of Captain Matthew Flinders. Includes footage of the Shrine; Mornington beach; Arthur’s Seat; Port Philip Bay; Station Peaks; Flinder’s Street Station; St Paul’s Cathedral; Swanston street; and the Matthew Flinders torch relay. Leading Victorian figures appear unveiling commemorative plaques. This is an un-edited film without a soundtrack which documents many of the celebrations.

results.title: RAAF Newsreel. No. 9. Operation sabre ferry
results.creator_credit: Harry Rayner and Australia. Royal Australian Air Force
results.brief_description: Newsreel items including: 1. No. 3 Squadron and No. 77 Squadron of the RAAF ferry the Sabre Jet from the east coast of Australia to Butterworth in Malaya via Townsville, Darwin, Netherlands New Guinea, Philippines, Borneo, Malaya. 2. Firefighter - RAAF demonstrates capability of new firefighting truck. 3. Addition of the new Air to Air Missile to the Sabre Jet Fighter. Test fired at Woomera.

results.title: Drought feeding
results.brief_description: Discusses the various fuel values of different foodstuffs and gives much information on drought feeding of stock. Based on scientific investigations made by the Australian wool board into the subject of drought feeding of sheep, this film shows the fuel value of various types of supplementary fodder, taking into account both cost and nutritive value. The Wool Board makes available to pastoralists a Drought Feed Calculator, together with other tables relating to drought feeding, are clearly presented in this film.
